# Punishments
## SL-7 Punishments [bold]SL-7-A[/bold] - Charges resulting in punishments must comply with SL-5 and SL-6. Refer to the [textlink="crimelist" link="CrimeList"] for a full list punisments under SL-7.
## SL-8 Probation [bold]SL-8-A[/bold] - Probation is a duration of punishment with Security supervision over the guilty party with a tracking implant, coordinates permanently on, or an electropack.
[bold]SL-8-B[/bold] - The Warden is responsible for supervision of all guilty parties under probation. The Warden at any time can summon guilty parties under probation to arrive at Security in order to debrief about progress or inform about rules of probation.
[bold]SL-8-C[/bold] - If a guilty party under probation prevents tracking by the Warden or breaks rules set by the Warden, then it may be considered a Breach of Probation.
## SL-9 Forced Labor [bold]SL-9-A[/bold] - Forced Labor is a duration of punishment where the guilty party will work in recompense with no pay for a specified job. The guilty party has to wear a prisoner jumpsuit and an electropack so Security can monitor the guilty party to ensure they are still working.
[bold]SL-9-B[/bold] - The Warden is responsible for ensuring guilty parties are working. The Warden at any time can summon guilty parties under forced labor to arrive at Security in order to debrief about progress. The Warden will block out time for the guilty party into work blocks and break blocks for the shift, ensuring the break blocks do not exceed the work blocks.
[bold]SL-9-C[/bold] - If a guilty party prevents tracking by the Warden, works during a break block or isn’t working during a work block, then they may be charged with Breach of Forced Labor.
## SL-10 Counciling [bold]SL-10-A[/bold] - Counselling is a duration of punishment where the guilty party will attend at least one session with a qualified psychologist for at least ten minutes and report progress to Security.
[bold]SL-10-B[/bold] - If there are no qualified psychologists then the Chief Medical Officer will instead run the session. If no-one else qualified exists then the session is deferred to the next shift and verbally communicated to the Warden. The guilty party is expected to, after attending a session, report to the Warden verbally in brief terms what happened in the session as well as the rough time it occurred.
[bold]SL-10-C[/bold] - If the guilty party does not attend a session or does not report to the Warden, then they may be charged with Breach of Counselling.
## SL-11 Incarceration [bold]SL-11-A[/bold] - Incarceration is a duration of a punishment where the guilty party will be held in custody in a contained secure area completely supervised by Security.
[bold]SL-11-B[/bold] - The Warden should sanction an area with growable food and easy access to water. The guilty party is not permitted to leave the sanctioned area until their duration is over, otherwise it is Breach of Incarceration.
## SL-12 Extradition [bold]SL-12-A[/bold] - Extradition is transfer of the guilty party to foreign prison that NanoTrasen has an extradition treaty with, to be held in custody permanently.
[bold]SL-12-B[/bold] - Extradition will be scheduled for at least one shift after the punishment was given. The guilty party may always appeal to the Sector Magistrate’s Court in this duration.
[bold]SL-12-C[/bold] - The guilty party is to be held in incarceration until their extradition, until the guilty party is handed to the foreign party.
## SL-13 Execution [bold]SL-13-A[/bold] - Execution is an authorised and planned cessation of life of the guilty party.
[bold]SL-13-B[/bold] - Execution will be scheduled for at least one shift after the punishment was given. The guilty party may always appeal to the Sector Magistrate’s Court in this duration.
[bold]SL-13-C[/bold] - The guilty party is to be held in incarceration until their execution. The Warden must ensure the guilty party is able to have a final meal of the guilty party's choice before their execution.
## SL-14 Parole Hearings [bold]SL-14-A[/bold] - A parole hearing is to determine the ableness for a guilty party to return into society without restrictions.
[bold]SL-14-B[/bold] - When the parol interval has elapsed, the guilty party will be eligible for a parole hearing.
[bold]SL-14-C[/bold] - The guilty party will convene with a lawyer if they can, and either the Warden of the Magistrate. Together they will discuss their state of recovery. If the Warden of the Magistrate believes that the guilty party has fully recovered, they may approve the parole.
## SL-15 Corporal Punishment [bold]SL-15-A[/bold] - Corporal Punishments have no due process and can immediately be assigned to a sophont with probable cause by a Warden, Head of Security, or rarely a Security Officer.
[bold]SL-15-B[/bold] - Corporal Punishments can include: Timed brig for up to twenty minutes. Public embarrassment. Catch and Release. Minor harm.
[bold]SL-15-C[/bold] - Corporal Punishments are enacted with executive privilege, and cannot be challenged in court.
